item.title: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to convey a parcel of real property to Beaver County, Utah.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands.

Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S9352-9353; text as passed Senate: CR S9352-9353)

item.title: S. 2285, A bill to direct the Secretary of the Interior to convey a parcel of real property to Beaver County, Utah
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on July 14, 2004

item.title: S. 2285, A bill to direct the Secretary of the Interior to convey a parcel of real property to Beaver County, Utah
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on July 14, 2004

summary.text: Requires the Secretary of the Interior to convey to Beaver County, Utah for public recreational use all right, title, and interest of the United States in specified real property.

Requires the Secretary of the Interior to convey to Beaver County, Utah, for public recreational use all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the approximately 200 acres identified as "Minersville State Park."

Permits the County to sell, for not less than fair market value, part of the property conveyed, if the proceeds of such sale are used by the County solely for maintenance of public recreation facilities located on the remainder of such property conveyed to it.

(This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the Senate on August 25, 2004. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Requires the Secretary of the Interior to convey to Beaver County, Utah, for public recreational use all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the approximately 200 acres identified as "Minersville State Park."

Permits the County to sell, for not less than fair market value, part of the property conveyed, if the proceeds of such sale are used by the County solely for maintenance of public recreation facilities located on the remainder of such property conveyed to it.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
